intro: Xolisma affinis, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a perennial herb with slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Xolisma affinis is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
